attributes.action: Review of higher education fees for all students enrolled prior to COVID-19
attributes.additional_details: Many students across the country are enrolled on higher education courses that have switched to exclusively online delivery. Of those who have persisted with this switch, rather than defer, student experiences have varied considerably. Regardless of individual experiences, I believe strongly that for this period, all students should pay no more in fees than what they would have paid had they chosen an online delivery mode, or their institution’s cheapest location at which to enrol.
attributes.background: Where higher education students have continued their courses online during the COVID-19 pandemic, fees for the disrupted period should be capped at that institution’s lowest advertised fee, as if it were an online course, or the institution’s cheapest location that the student had enrolled upon.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The Government sets the maximum universities can charge for tuition fees, but decisions about different rates of tuition fees set by universities are a matter for indiviudal universities. It is also not clear how your proposal would work for universities that only have one rate of tuition fees.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Refund ALL University student tuition fees due to lack of quality in education: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555516

Require universities to fully refund tuition fees for the Autumn term: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555583

Reduce student loan debts by the cost of all tuition fees paid during Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560953

Lower tuition fees to a minimum £5,000 for University students during covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571221

Require universities to reimburse students 1/3 of their tuition fees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573664
